result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr.

defendant.name: Ganz-Brown, Robert Henry, Jr.
defendant.address: 11567 E Hazel Prairie Rd, Lake Nebagamon, WI 54849

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:03 AM Defendant Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF365, 22CM291, and 22CM292. 

Parties proceed with preliminary hearing in 22CF365. State calls Detective Matthew Izzard, Detective with Douglas County Sheriff's Office. Matthew Izzard is sworn and testifies. State direct examines the witness. Incident occurred in Douglas County, WI. Attorney Hoffman, objects to hearsay and lack of foundation. Court sustains objection. State continues to direct examine the witness. Attorney Hoffman, objects to hearsay and lack of foundation. Court sustains objection, asks State to clarify questions. State continues to direct examine the witness. Witness identifies the defendant. Attorney Hoffman cross examines the witness. State makes argument, asks for bind over. Attorney Hoffman makes argument, opposes bind over. Does not think any legal theories have been met. 

Based on witness testimony, Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed. Binds defendant over for arraignment. 

In 22CM291 and 22CM292, Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading and enters a plea(s) of not guilty. State asks for $500 in 22CM291. No special conditions. State asks for $500 in 22CM292. No contact with JTs One Stop in Solon Springs. State notes the nature of the offenses. Recites previous criminal convictions, FTAs and probation revocations. Attorney Hoffman notes has live din Douglas county area his entire life. Is not on probation or parole. Notes that he is already unable to post in his CF file. Asks for about $100 cash per file. 

Court orders $200 in 22CM291. No special conditions. Court orders $500 in 22CM292. No contact with JTs One Stop in Solon Springs.
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with TA or JS. No contact with addresses 210 37th Ave E Superior, WI and 2076 S Peterson Rd in the Town of Lakeside.

3:42 PM Defendant Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Not guilty plea(s) entered. Defendant's address confirmed. 
2500cb No contact with TA or JS. No contact with addresses 210 37th Ave E Superior, WI and 2076 S Peterson Rd in the Town of Lakeside.
State recites criminal convictions, probation revoked x 2, reviews minnesota criminal history and has 1 fta. State notes there are additional charges pending.
Attorney makes argument; lifelong resident, family ties, self employed in Lake Nebagamon or Douglas County area.  Does not believe he is on probation.  Can post $500 at the most.
Court questions what the Lake Nebagamon address is; defendant indicates that is his mother's home.
Court cites concerns; nature of charges and prison exposure. Concerned about serious prior convictions and local ties. 
State notes that defendant fled when officers were attempting to take him into custody.
Court orders $3000cb No contact with TA or JS. No contact with addresses 210 37th Ave E Superior, WI and 2076 S Peterson Rd in the Town of Lakeside.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
